content: As an AI language model, I think that artists will likely continue to release both full-length albums and shorter EPs. Streaming platforms like Spotify and Apple Music have made it easier for artists to release music more frequently and in smaller formats such as singles and EPs, which can help them maintain listeners' interest and keep their music fresh in the minds of fans. Additionally, with the rise of music streaming, there is less of a need for an artist to release a full album in order to get their music heard. However, there are still many fans who appreciate the format and storytelling potential of a full-length album, and there are still benefits to releasing a cohesive, thematically focused body of work. Ultimately, the decision to release an album or an EP may depend on a range of factors, including the artist's creative vision, their label's strategy, and their current audience demands.
